Key Arguments: The bill undermines the fundamental right of freedom of speech.
Definitions of 'misinformation' are subjective and should not be determined by a government agency.
Existing laws already address information that incites violence.
The bill grants excessive powers to authorities, leading to potential censorship.
Freedom of speech is essential for democratic participation and self-responsibility.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is an individual view and to try and place a ‘balance’ of what is allowed, can only undermine this fundamental right.
To have a government agency that decides the definition of 'misinformation' raises concerns.
This bill provides exorbitant powers to the authorities and will lead to censorship of those who fit into their definitions.
